column4: dc:description
column14: dc:creator

column4: Technical measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Category of technical measures consisting of pseudoanonymization and encryption
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Encryption of data when being stored (persistent encryption)
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Encryption of data in transit e.g. when being transferred from one location to another, including sharing
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: PseudoAnonmyization or 'pseudonymisationâ€™ means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person;
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Process by identifiable personal data (PII) is converted to un-identifiable personal data
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: process by which personal data is irreversibly altered in such a way that a data subject can no longer be identified directly or indirectly, either by the data controller alone or in collaboration with any other party
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: methods which restrict access to a place or resource
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: protocols involving validation of identity i.e. authentication of a person or information
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Restrictions required or followed regarding storage of data
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: A duration or temporal entity denoting limitation on storage of personal data
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Defines a location or goespatial scope, where the data is (physically) stored
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Defines how secure deletion is guaranteed
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Regularity and temporal span of data restoration/backup mechanisms that guarantee that data is preserved
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Organisational measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Specifies procedures for determining permission or authority
column10: non-technical authorisation procedures: How is it described on an organisational level, who gets access to the data
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: A legally binding agreement
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Non-disclosure Agreements e.g. preserving confidentiality of information
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Contractual terms governing data handling within the data controller
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Guidelines or Principles regarding processing and operational measures
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: A set of rules or procedures outlining the norms and practices for conducting activities
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: A set of rules or guidelines outlining criterias for design
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Practices regarding selecting appropriate data protection and privacy measures as the 'default' in an activity or service
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Risk management refers to a coordinated set of activities and methods that is used to direct an organization and to control the many risks that can affect its ability to achieve objectives.  The term risk management also refers to the programme that is used to manage risk. This programme includes risk management principles, a risk management framework, and a risk management process.
column10: Data Protection Impact Assessments as per GDPR art 35, other Privacy Impact Assessments, threat severity assessment https://www.cnil.fr/en/privacy-impact-assessment-pia
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Practices regarding incorporating data protection and privacy in the design of information and services
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Specifies policy regarding repetition or renewal of existing certification(s)
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Practices and policies regarding training of staff members
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Category of certifications, seals, and marks indicating compliance to regulations or practices
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: certification mechanisms, seals, and marks for the purpose of demonstrating compliance
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: a seal or a mark indicating proof of certification to some certification or standard
column14: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column4: Denotes source of data i.e. where the data is sourced from
column10: Source is direct point of data collection; 'origin' would indicate the original/others points of where the data originates from
column14: Georg, Harsh, Beatriz

column4: Denotes origin of data i.e. where the data originates from

column4: a generic ObjectProperty to describe how the measure is implemented.  For the values of this property we either allow a blank node with a single rdfs:comment to describe the measure, or a URI to a standard or best practice followed, i.e. a well-known identifier for that standard or a URL where the respective document describes the standard.
column14: Axel Polleres
